page.title: 10ARMTHORPE & MINERS' STRIKE
page.content: {HOW IT BEGAN:}In March 1984 the NCB decided to close Cortonwood Colliery in South Yorkshire.This decision was to cause one of the most serious industrial disputes ever seen. {THE EFFECTS:}The NUM was at the time committed to preventing pit closures . With the closure of Cortonwood the Yorkshire Coalfield came to a halt. A few years previously the Yorkshire Miners balloted on a 2 issue ballot paper.One issue was not to close any uneconomic pits.The Yorkshire Miners got support from all fields but Notts. {THE VIOLENCE:}The dispute caused bitter conflict between police & pickets because 10 men wanted to work. At one stage (August) Armthorpe was cordoned off by police. {THE END:}The strike ended on May 14th but Markham Main returned on 17th the last Yorkshire pit to do so.
